metadata.title: CVE-2019-17531 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - medium
metadata.description:
A Polymorphic Typing issue was discovered in FasterXML jackson-databind2.0.0 through 2.9.10. When Default Typing is enabled (either globally orfor a specific property) for an externally exposed JSON endpoint and theservice has the apache-log4j-extra (version 1.2.x) jar in the classpath,and an attacker can provide a JNDI service to access, it is possible tomake the service execute a malicious payload.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-17531` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libjackson2-databind-java - 2.10.1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: jackson-databind package in oracular, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.10.1-1').
